overallFeedback.feedback: You wrote a well-structured essay. You effectively used transitions between paragraphs and sentences to keep your essay organized and easy to read. Your introduction and conclusion are well-written and provide a strong beginning and ending. Your essay is clear and concise, and your writing is organized and free of errors.

You demonstrate a strong understanding of how the author builds his argument and uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience. Your analysis is thorough and accurate, and you effectively explain how the author uses various features to strengthen his argument.

You demonstrate a strong understanding of the text. Your essay accurately summarizes the main points of the text, and you effectively explain the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience.

To further improve your essay, focus on using more precise language to explain the author's argument and the evidence and reasoning used to support it. Additionally, pay attention to the details of the text and make sure that you accurately and thoroughly explain how the author uses various features to strengthen his argument.

targetedFeedback.quote: In Paul Bogard's article “Let there be dark” he's building an arguement to persuade his audience to preserve natural darkness.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You accurately summarize the main point of the text, and you demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose. However, you could have used more precise language to explain the author's argument and the evidence and reasoning used to support it.

targetedFeedback.quote: Bogard uses a personal story, appeals to people's emotions, and states benefits of natural darkness.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You accurately summarize the evidence and reasoning the author uses to support his argument. You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience.

targetedFeedback.quote: By using a personal story Bogard allows his audience to connect to him.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You demonstrate a strong understanding of how the author uses language to effectively persuade his audience. You accurately explain how the author's use of a personal story allows the audience to connect to him.

targetedFeedback.quote: The personal story also shows that the issue of preserving natural darkness isn't just another topic to write about but something that he is actually passionate for.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience. You accurately explain how the author's use of a personal story conveys his passion for the issue.

targetedFeedback.quote: In his personal story Bogard uses great imagery making the audience picture what he saw and maybe make them want to experience it too.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience. You accurately explain how the author's use of imagery allows the audience to experience what he saw.

targetedFeedback.quote: Bogard uses pathos by stating examples that appeal to people's emotions.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You accurately explain how the author's use of pathos appeals to the audience's emotions. You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience.

targetedFeedback.quote: In the article he wrote “Those of us over 35 are perhaps among the last generation to have known truly dark nights.”
targetedFeedback.feedback: You accurately quote the author and explain how he uses pathos to appeal to his audience's emotions. You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience.

targetedFeedback.quote: Bogard writes about the benefits that natural darkness actually produces.
targetedFeedback.feedback: You accurately summarize the evidence and reasoning the author uses to support his argument. You demonstrate a good understanding of the author's purpose and how he uses evidence and reasoning to persuade his audience.
